title: Grade K
subject: Visual Arts, Music, Dance, and Theater (2011-)

document.title: Michigan Merit Curriculum: Visual Arts, Music, Dance, and Theater

401EE540DFE60131A46B68A86D17958E.description: Explore connections between the visual arts and other curriculum.

401E85B0DFE60131A46A68A86D17958E.description: Identify how pattern, shape, rhythm, and movement are used throughout the arts.

401E1690DFE60131A46968A86D17958E.description: Identify and speak about artists as people who generate new ideas and create art.

401DACA0DFE60131A46868A86D17958E.description: Identify and discuss art in the student's environment.

401CAF90DFE60131A46768A86D17958E.description: Recognize, analyze, and describe connections among the arts; between the arts and other disciplines; between the arts and everyday life.

401BFDC0DFE60131A46568A86D17958E.description: Share student's family and culture through discussion and artwork.

401BA1E0DFE60131A46468A86D17958E.description: Identify and talk about artwork found around the world.

401B4700DFE60131A46368A86D17958E.description: Understand that humans from all cultures, past or present, have created art.

401AE3F0DFE60131A46268A86D17958E.description: Understand, analyze, and describe the arts in their historical, social, and cultural contexts.

40196730DFE60131A45E68A86D17958E.description: Describe the sensory qualities in a work of art.

4018F6C0DFE60131A45D68A86D17958E.description: Recognize that art can be created for self-expression or fun.

40160140DFE60131A45C68A86D17958E.description: Explore and discuss why artists create.

4015B410DFE60131A45B68A86D17958E.description: Analyze, describe, and evaluate works of art.

401492B0DFE60131A45868A86D17958E.description: Express thoughts and ideas through the creation of artwork.

40143640DFE60131A45768A86D17958E.description: Select subject matter and communicate a personal story in a painting or drawing.

4013E500DFE60131A45668A86D17958E.description: Participate in discussions of the aspects of environment, family, and home in the creation of art.

40138ED0DFE60131A45568A86D17958E.description: Use a variety of lines, colors, and basic geometric shapes and patterns to creatively express feelings and personal experiences.

40133E40DFE60131A45468A86D17958E.description: Explore the basic uses of art materials to produce artwork.

4012E160DFE60131A45368A86D17958E.description: Apply skills and knowledge to create in the arts.

40120E00DFE60131A45168A86D17958E.description: Prepare, complete, and sign finished artwork.

40119EE0DFE60131A45068A86D17958E.description: Explore the elements of art through playful sensory experiences.

40113700DFE60131A44F68A86D17958E.description: Work with materials and tools safely with environmental awareness.

4010D830DFE60131A44E68A86D17958E.description: Identify and explore a variety of materials to communicate personal experiences.

40108E80DFE60131A44D68A86D17958E.description: Apply skills and knowledge to perform in the arts.

400FAC30DFE60131A44A68A86D17958E.description: Participate in arts activities that focus on everyday life.

400F5490DFE60131A44968A86D17958E.description: Understand that performances are presented in various multimedia forms.

400EE540DFE60131A44868A86D17958E.description: Recognize, analyze, and describe connections among the arts; between the arts and other disciplines; between the arts and everyday life.

400E5A00DFE60131A44668A86D17958E.description: Identify that stories come in a variety of forms.

400E0CF0DFE60131A44568A86D17958E.description: Become aware that art forms come from all cultures.

400DC140DFE60131A44468A86D17958E.description: Understand, analyze, and describe the arts in their historical, social, and cultural contexts.

400D1830DFE60131A44268A86D17958E.description: Communicate likes and dislikes prompted by performances.

400CC370DFE60131A44168A86D17958E.description: Recognize the character's wants and needs.

400C61E0DFE60131A44068A86D17958E.description: Receive teacher comments and direction regarding classroom dramatizations.

400C0A20DFE60131A43F68A86D17958E.description: Respond to teacher questions regarding personal opinions about character, place, and plot.

400BB940DFE60131A43E68A86D17958E.description: Reference story details to formulate personal preferences.

400B6500DFE60131A43D68A86D17958E.description: Repeat sequence of events through guided practice.

400B20E0DFE60131A43C68A86D17958E.description: Use the vocabulary of theatre to identify theatrical experiences.

400ADC40DFE60131A43B68A86D17958E.description: Analyze, describe, and evaluate works of art.

400A4FC0DFE60131A43968A86D17958E.description: Recognize simple scenery, costumes, sound, and props in the dramatic process.

40099E80DFE60131A43768A86D17958E.description: Differentiate between dramatic play and creative drama.

40095340DFE60131A43668A86D17958E.description: Recognize characters, environments, and situations that support the creation of a classroom dramatization.

40090E00DFE60131A43568A86D17958E.description: Apply skills and knowledge to create in the arts.

40088300DFE60131A43368A86D17958E.description: Recognize a variety of real and non-real characters through guided dramatization.

400834F0DFE60131A43268A86D17958E.description: Imitate and recreate the sounds of objects, animals, and people.

4007E350DFE60131A43168A86D17958E.description: Apply skills and knowledge to perform in the arts.

40070250DFE60131A42E68A86D17958E.description: Discuss the various rationales for using music in daily experiences.

4006BE90DFE60131A42D68A86D17958E.description: Observe and identify cross-curricular connections within the kindergarten curriculum.

400676B0DFE60131A42C68A86D17958E.description: Observe and identify similarities and differences in the meanings of common vocabulary used in the various kindergarten arts.

40062470DFE60131A42B68A86D17958E.description: Recognize, analyze, and describe connections among the arts; between the arts and other disciplines; between the arts and everyday life.

40059AD0DFE60131A42968A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate audience appropriate behavior for the context and style of music presented and performed in kindergarten.

40054740DFE60131A42868A86D17958E.description: Describe how elements of music are used in examples from world cultures, using music performed and presented in kindergarten.

4004F760DFE60131A42768A86D17958E.description: Identify and describe distinguishing characteristics of starkly contrasting styles.

40049400DFE60131A42668A86D17958E.description: Understand, analyze, and describe the arts in their historical, social, and cultural contexts.

4003DA30DFE60131A42468A86D17958E.description: Identify and support personal reactions to a musical selection.

40036420DFE60131A42368A86D17958E.description: Devise student-created criteria for objective evaluation of performances and compositions.

40031710DFE60131A42268A86D17958E.description: Categorize the timbre of non-pitched percussion instruments. Identify male, female, and children's voices.

4002C880DFE60131A42168A86D17958E.description: Introduce music vocabulary emphasizing opposites; i.e. fast and slow, loud and soft.

40027370DFE60131A42068A86D17958E.description: Describe the music performed and presented in kindergarten by moving, drawing, or through other appropriate responses.

40022C70DFE60131A41F68A86D17958E.description: Use invented or standard notation to transcribe increasingly difficult rhythms and melodies.

4001E4E0DFE60131A41E68A86D17958E.description: Identify echo songs and recognize the same and different sections of the music when presented aurally.

40019DF0DFE60131A41D68A86D17958E.description: All students will analyze, describe, and evaluate works of art.

40010850DFE60131A41B68A86D17958E.description: Add vocal and physical responses to a selection presented in kindergarten.

4000B3E0DFE60131A41A68A86D17958E.description: Use a variety of traditional and non-traditional sound sources and electronic media when composing, arranging, and improvising appropriate to kindergarten.

40006870DFE60131A41968A86D17958E.description: Create a song about self and family.

400016C0DFE60131A41868A86D17958E.description: Create vocal embellishments for a song or rhyme.

3FFFC580DFE60131A41768A86D17958E.description: Create through exploration, improvisation, and composition, an answer to a melodic question.

3FFF7270DFE60131A41668A86D17958E.description: Create through exploration, improvisation, and composition, an accompaniment for a selection with nonpitched percussion classroom instruments.

3FFF2560DFE60131A41568A86D17958E.description: Apply skills and knowledge to create in the arts.

3FFE4390DFE60131A41268A86D17958E.description: Use a system to read two or more pitches. (sol, mi)

3FFDDAA0DFE60131A41168A86D17958E.description: Use a system to read quarter notes and quarter rests.

3FFD8380DFE60131A41068A86D17958E.description: Play a steady beat in a group while other students sing a song.

3FFD39B0DFE60131A40F68A86D17958E.description: Replicate short rhythmic and melodic patterns.

3FFC6D30DFE60131A40D68A86D17958E.description: Follow cues of the conductor to begin and for a cut-off.

3FFC2890DFE60131A40C68A86D17958E.description: Sing melodies with confidence in a large group.

3FFBE350DFE60131A40B68A86D17958E.description: Sing and play expressively utilizing extreme opposites of dynamics and interpretation.

3FFB9BE0DFE60131A40A68A86D17958E.description: Sing and play music from a variety of styles and cultures.

3FFB4B90DFE60131A40968A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate uses of the voice, proper instrumental technique, and steady beat.

3FFAE860DFE60131A40868A86D17958E.description: Apply skills and knowledge to perform in the arts.

3FF9FE00DFE60131A40568A86D17958E.description: View a dance film and with teacher assistance, relate it to literature.

3FF9B760DFE60131A40468A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to draw alphabet letters in the air using parts of the body.

3FF96BD0DFE60131A40368A86D17958E.description: With teacher assistance, create a chart of good health habits for their room.

3FF915B0DFE60131A40268A86D17958E.description: Identify three personal goals with teacher assistance.

3FF8CB00DFE60131A40168A86D17958E.description: Recognize, analyze, and describe connections among the arts; between the arts and other disciplines; between the arts and everyday life.

3FF81F40DFE60131A3FF68A86D17958E.description: Learn and perform a simple dance from one culture.

3FF7D460DFE60131A3FE68A86D17958E.description: Understand, analyze, and describe the arts in their historical, social, and cultural contexts.

3FF6F680DFE60131A3FB68A86D17958E.description: Experience an age-appropriate dance or dance concert, and discuss the experience.

3FF6B240DFE60131A3FA68A86D17958E.description: Explore tossing and catching an object on different levels.

3FF66D90DFE60131A3F968A86D17958E.description: Identify basic locomotor movements by name.

3FF61C20DFE60131A3F868A86D17958E.description: Analyze, describe, and evaluate works of art.

3FF561B0DFE60131A3F668A86D17958E.description: Become familiar with video tape equipment and process.

3FF51980DFE60131A3F568A86D17958E.description: Follow teacher-directed simple movement patterns using the element of force.

3FF4D5D0DFE60131A3F468A86D17958E.description: Explore contrasting concepts such as high and low, big and small.

3FF49000DFE60131A3F368A86D17958E.description: Follow teacher-directed movement responses involving props; e.g., scarves, bean bags, parachute.

3FF3FC60DFE60131A3F168A86D17958E.description: Apply skills and knowledge to create in the arts.

3FF36380DFE60131A3EF68A86D17958E.description: Follow the movement lead of the teacher.

3FF31910DFE60131A3EE68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to walk with a partner.

3FF2CD60DFE60131A3ED68A86D17958E.description: Identify body parts by touching: head, neck, arms, legs, feet, shoulders, and knees.

3FF27DA0DFE60131A3EC68A86D17958E.description: Move at moderate tempo while in personal space, with the teacher and without the teacher.

3FF22F90DFE60131A3EB68A86D17958E.description: Explore personal space while standing, sitting.

3FF1DA10DFE60131A3EA68A86D17958E.description: Explore low, middle, and high levels.

3FF18C70DFE60131A3E968A86D17958E.description: Introduce and explore non-locomotor/axial movements in personal space by bending, stretching, reaching, and twisting.

3FF14220DFE60131A3E868A86D17958E.description: Explore basic locomotor movements; e.g., walk, run, gallop, slide, and jump moving in a straight pathway.

3FF0FA20DFE60131A3E768A86D17958E.description: Apply skills and knowledge to perform in the arts.
